items.content_html:
This property is unsupported:

  • I used spec_url to fix the Specification table.
  • I remove the browser-compat key and hardcoded the compat information. Once somebody implements it, this will come back. Our processes ensure that this will not be forgotten.
  • I removed the example section as it wasn't an example but just a repetition of the syntax.

Note that, nowadays, we won't merge PRs for proposed features. But this dates from the Wiki era of MDN.
items.title: Fix spec and browser-compat tables for mask-border-mode

items.content_html: Grid row is singular in the Glossary.
items.title: Fix broken glossary links

items.content_html: This is a SVG attribute used as a CSS property. cssxref doesn't work well with these, so I used a Markdown link instead.
items.title: Don't use cssxref for SVG attributes

items.content_html:
The font-variant descriptor has been removed in 2018 from the spec (see note in the MDN article) and has never been implemented by browsers.

We should just remove it from this list.
items.title: Remove link to a never-implemented descriptor

items.content_html: The article's title use the singular, hence the red link as the link was to the plural version of the word.
items.title: Fix link to glossary

items.content_html: They are on Element not HTMLElement.
items.title: Fix links to transition events

items.content_html: Some functions don't have their own page, as they are specific to one property. I'm using a link with a fragment. I also uniformized the use of parentheses.
items.title: Fix red links to documented CSS functions

items.content_html:
All these links lead to redirects (and each a flaw).

This fixes it; we may want to update the HTMLElement macro in the future or to have separate pages, but I don't feel in the mood of launching the discussion and doing that now.
items.title: Fix links to h1/h2/... elements

items.content_html: We moved them under image/ long ago. This PR fixes the links.
items.title: Fix links to CSS image-related functions (like gradients)

items.content_html: This is by far the best explanation about XML namespaces. It may move when we refactor the SVG area, but no need to wait for this to link for it (as the original link was a red link anyway).
items.title: Change broken link to pertinent link (about XML namespaces)

items.content_html: The title said it all.
items.title: Remove IE-only broken link in See also

items.content_html:
While reading the Cascade Layers page, I came across a section that I found difficult to understand, and wanted to try to make it easier for future readers to understand the concepts.

I significantly expanded the explanation and added some additional assumptions to make in the introductory phase of this section.

I felt that it was difficult to grasp the material in the way it was written and spent a significant amount of time re-reading the section before I was able to understand the meaning behind the message being conveyed. I expanded the section significantly but I think it will help readers understand the concepts quicker than the way it was worded previously.

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: Readability within Cascade_Layers page

items.content_html:
Currently, this page states, in the summary, that the next topic of study is the box model.

However, the 'next' button is linked to the Cascade_layers page, and topics in the sidebar on the left are listed in this order:

...
-Cascade, specificity, and inheritance
-Cascade layers
-The box model
...

My proposal makes the links redundant, so maybe the best approach is to remove the link in the summary statement altogether.

Changed the link in the summary statement to go to the next topic, cascade layers, instead of the current linked page, the box model, which skips over a topic in the list.

This could be intentional, but it feels strange to have a link after the words "Next up" and a link on the "Next" button go to different pages.

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: Fix link to next content page

The wikipedia page is of good quality, let's link to it instead.

items.content_html:
Description

This PR adds docs for the View Transitions Module Level 1, which is available in Chrome 111+.

See my research document for more information on exactly what this work entails.

A couple of notes:

  • My basic demo is currently contained in a glitch instance, but I am happy to change the URLs over as soon as the dom-examples repo version has been merged.
  • For details on what exactly happens in the transition style sheet during a view transition, I've linked to relevant sections of the spec. I looked into this and felt that this was quite complex and mostly a set of internal details, which most people won't care about, but you might possibly need it if you are creating custom view transitions and want full knowledge of what you are overriding. Let me know what you think.

Motivation

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests

Fixes #24425
items.title: Add docs for the View Transitions Module Level 1

items.title: Clarify the use of `:not` with invalid selectors
